author: 16bitakira

text: @Arc13 The series, Stand Alone Complex, and the Ghost in the Sell Movie(1995) are actually two different storylines/universes. Both feature the same characters but the plotlines are drastically different. The series did get itself a movie Remake(The Laughing Man Complex) which retells the main story of the series while tying up some loose ends.
author: Gouzaku Fuwachi

text: @MultiLelde The original manga was made from 1989-1990, the movie is from 1995. There is also a "Ghost in the Shell 2.0", which was made in 2008. It has remastered sound and video with added CGI but don't bother with it. It might sound good at first but the original is movie has a better feel to it and the added CGI is ugly and unnecessary most of the time.
author: Wynard

text: @bregowine Yeah, the original manga is very different from the movie. I don't like to compare them, but I like both ways of presenting the story.
author: Wynard

text: The tank scene in the museum is one of my favourite movie scenes ever. Just hearing the music gives me massive flashbacks of how much I love it. Thank you for posting this.
author: Wynard

text:
@sevinPackage Okay, maybe not a LOT of drum n bass influence... more like early prodigy-style techno influence.
It's actually got a nice balance of ambient/atmospheric pieces and action segments. I enjoyed the Armitage III OST just a little more than I enjoyed the movie.
author: sevinPackage

text: If you haven't heard it yet, I recommend the soundtrack to Armitage the Third, another anime about an ass-kicking female android. Lots of DnB influence.

text:
@SupraDarky Hey supradarky,on an unrelated note to this video, may I suggest a pretty obscure vgm for the list (or at least for you to hear,if you don't know it?)? it's from key of heaven,a game for the psp I reccomend for fans of action rpg's and its main theme is freaking gorgeous (but,again,rare). Please help this peculiar game be known by more people.


Great job and continue the awesome uploads.

author: Tyrone Biggums

text: The first Matrix movie was playing on TV yesterday and it reminded to watch its inspiration, Ghost in the Shell, again after 15 years. I enjoyed it even more since I probably was too young to really pay attention to the story at the time. So yeah, I decided to upload an ambient track from that movie today, the one I liked the most while watching.
author: SupraDarky
